Legal_Issue: RAD's authority to decide on grounds not considered by RPD
Procedural fairness in refugee claim assessment
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, SC 2001, c 27
Credibility_Assessment: RPD raised credibility concerns; RAD did not address them
Evidence_Type: New evidence introduced by RAD not reviewed by RPD
Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA allowing RAD to confirm or substitute RPD decisions
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, SC 2001, c 27
Application_Error: RAD decided on IFA without notifying parties or addressing RPD's credibility findings
Review_Outcome: Case remitted to a different RAD panel for redetermination
Application_Factor: Failure to address prior credibility concerns
Decision_Outcome: Dismissal of refugee claim by RAD
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether RAD erred by deciding on grounds not raised by RPD
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, SC 2001, c 27
Cause_of_Refusal: Reliance on Internal Flight Alternative without resolving credibility issues
Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, SC 2001, c 27
Evidentiary_Issues: Introduction of new evidence not considered by RPD
Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to lack of notice and opportunity to respond on IFA issue
Credibility_Issues: RPD found credibility concerns; RAD failed to reconcile with IFA finding
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging procedural fairness and jurisdictional overreach
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide procedural fairness in introducing new basis for denial
Omission_Type: Failure to notify parties of new issue
